definition:
greater than half                                      
             
             for the better part of an hour

improved in health or mental attitude                                      
             
             feeling better

more attractive, favorable, or commendable                                      
             
             in better circumstances

more advantageous or effective                                      
             
             a better solution

improved in accuracy or performance                                      
             
             building a better engine
to make better (see better entry 1): such as

to make more tolerable or acceptable                                      
             
             trying to better the lot of slum dwellers

to make more complete or perfect                                      
             
             looked forward to bettering her acquaintance with the new neighbors

to surpass in excellence : excel                                      
             
             bettered his personal record by nearly three seconds

to become better                                      
             
             … must be bettering instead of worsening.

in a more excellent manner                                      
             
             sings better than I do

to greater advantage : preferably                                      
             
             some things are better left unsaid

to a higher or greater degree                                      
             
             he knows the story better than you do

more                                      
             
             it is better than nine miles to the next town

something better (see better entry 1)                                      
             
             I expected better from them

a superior especially in merit or rank                                      
             
             was respectful of his betters

advantage, victory                                      
             
             get the better of her

had better (see better entry 3 sense 1b)                                      
             
             you better hurry
higher in quality
more skillful
more attractive, appealing, effective, useful, etc.
to make (something) better
to be or do better than (something or someone) : to improve on (something or someone)
in a better way
—used to suggest that something should or should not be done
to a higher or greater degree
something that is better : better behavior

more satisfactory or skillful than another                                      
                

            a better solution
    
                

            a better player

improved in health                                      
             
             I was sick but now I'm better.

more than half                                      
             
             We waited the better part of an hour.

to make or become more satisfactory                                      
             
             They are trying to better their performance.

in a superior or more excellent way                                      
             
             He sings better than I do.

to a higher or greater degree                                      
             
             She knows the story better than I do.

something that is more satisfactory                                      
             
             This is a change for the better.

advantage sense 2, victory                                      
             
             She got the better of her opponent.

feeling better

a better solution
building a better engine

sings better than I do
some things are better left unsaid
he knows the story better than you do

was respectful of his betters

Her second book is better than her first one.
This one is no better than that one.
She's a better golfer than I am.
He's a better singer than he is an actor.
He's much better with children now that he's a father himself.
The weather is better today than it was yesterday.
They came up with a better solution to the problem.
Don't you have something better to do than to watch TV all day?
Her work wasn't that good at first, but it's getting better.
Her work just keeps getting better and better.
They are trying to better the lives of working people.
He looked forward to bettering his acquaintance with the new neighbors.
The team has bettered its chances of winning the championship.
She bettered her previous performance.
He set a record that has never been equaled or bettered.
“How is she doing in school?” “She did badly at first, but now she's doing much better.”
She sings better than I do.
He sings better than he acts.
“Instead of writing to her, I'm going to visit her in person.” “Even better.”
He knows the story much better than you do.
Her paintings have become better known in recent years.
There's nothing I'd like better than to see you again.
They shouldn't treat him that way. He deserves better.
be polite to your betters and to your inferiors in equal measure
I was sick but now I'm better.
We waited the better part of an hour.
They are trying to better their performance.
He sings better than I do.
She knows the story better than I do.
This is a change for the better.
She got the better of her opponent.

definition: more satisfactory, suitable, pleasant, effective, or of higher quality etc
more skilful
used for saying that someone is not as ill as they were before, or that something is not as painful as it was before
in: She’s trying to find a better job.
better than: The results were better than we had expected.
get better  (=improve): The situation is unlikely to get better in the foreseeable future.
much/far/a lot better: I can think of far better ways of spending a million pounds.
little/no better: There was a growing economic crisis in Asia, and things were no better in Europe.
Maggie’s a better cook than I’ll ever be.
better at: Alec is a lot better at sport than I am.
She’s a little better today, but I think she should stay in bed.
You’ll feel better when you’ve had something to eat.
Is your headache any better?
better for something  (=healthier as a result of something): I had a good rest, and I’m feeling a lot better for it.
be (all) the better for something
be better than nothing
be no better than
better for someone
better luck next time
better still/yet
for better or (for) worse
the sooner/bigger/quicker etc the better
would be better doing something

definition:
comparative of 
        
         good  : of a higher standard, or more suitable, pleasing, or effective than other things or people:
If you are or get better after an illness or injury, you are healthy again:
to improve:
in a more suitable, pleasing, or satisfactory way, or to a greater degree:
to a greater degree, when used as the comparative of adjectives beginning with "good" or "well":
used to say that a particular choice would be more satisfactory:
used to give advice or to make a threat:
it would be wiser:
something that is of a higher standard than something else:
behaviour, work, or treatment that is more suitable, pleasing, or satisfactory:
people of a higher rank or social position than you:
to improve a situation:
to improve your social position, often by getting a better job or education:
of a higher standard, or more suitable, pleasing, or effective than other things or people; comparative ofgood:
Better can also be used as the comparative to form adjectives beginning with good:
to a greater degree, or in a more suitable, pleasing, or satisfactory way; comparative ofwell:
If you are or get better after an illness or injury, you are healthy and no longer ill.
to improve a situation, condition, or person:
used in comparisons to show that a condition is improved:
in: He stood near the front to get a better view.
Relations between the two countries have never been better.
It's much better to have a small, cosy room than a big, cold one.
The book was better than I expected.
She is much better at tennis than I am.
It is far (= much) better to save some of your money than to spend it all at once.
Fresh vegetables are better for you (= more beneficial to you) than canned ones.
The longer you keep this wine, the better it tastes (= it has a better flavour if you keep it for a long time).
The bed was hard, but it was better than nothing (= than not having a bed).
I hope you get better soon.
After the ceasefire, the situation in the capital got better.
She's getting much better at pronouncing English words.
The next time he took the test, he was better prepared.
They did much better (= were more successful) in the second half of the game.
I like this jacket much better than (= I prefer it to) the other one.
She knows her way around the college better than I do.
She is better-looking (= more attractive) than her brother.
He is much better known for his poetry than his songwriting.
Why don't you give her a call or, better still, go and see her?
You'd better (= you should) go home now before the rain starts.
He'd better pay me back that money he owes me soon, or else.
You would do better to bring the plants inside when the weather gets colder.
He ran the 100 metres in 9.91 seconds, and I have not seen better (= a faster result) this year.
You shouldn't be so mean to your mother - she deserves better.
I didn't think he would go out without telling me - I expected better of him.
As children, we were taught not to argue with our elders and betters.
The organization was established to better conditions for the disabled.
He tried to better himself by taking evening classes.
He sat near the front to get a better view.
She’s good-looking, and her brother is even better-looking.
I like this jacket much better than the brown one.
She did much better (= She was more successful) in the second part of the exam.
The cleaner the glass is, the better you can see.

translated_as@ru: он/ты и т. д. бы лучше …

translated_as@fr: a finalement triomphé de son adversaire
La curiosité a eu raison de moi.
un meilleur conducteur que son frère
Ce vin a bien meilleur goût.
mais ça n’est pas assez sûr.
J’espère que tu iras bientôt mieux.
Il vaut toujours mieux demander à un médecin.
J’ai réussi cette épreuve mieux que personne.
Je n’ai pas appelé pendant un moment mais mieux vaut tard que jamais.
plus il y a de / plus c’est grand/tôt
Amène tous tes amis ; plus il y aura de monde
mieux ce sera / plus on est de fous
Vous feriez mieux de rentrer maintenant.

definition: means Command (an order)

Marginalized Orientations, Gender identities, And Intersex. it’s meant to be an all inclusive umbrella term for asexuals, homosexuals, multisexuals, trans people, and intersex people. Alternative to LGBTQIAP+
Alternative to MOGII, easier to pronounce.
More dateable; more attractiveReferring to a girl who is already good looking, but does something that makes a man lose interest.
word commonly used by an individual to describe superiority over another in any event

Better is an adjective; comparative of GOOD.

Better is used to discribe somthing that is higher in value or worth than another thing. Somtimes it's used to discribe people. It can be one of these five:
1 : greater than half
2 : improved in health or mental attitude
3 : more attractive, favorable, or commendable
4 : more advantageous or effective
5 : improved in accuracy or performance
It's just "Better"
to use a good word as a manner of a bad one.. to emphasise a bad word to make it worse than what it actually is..
